```{r concluded loans}
# filter out all observations with loan_status == Current

concluded_loans <- subset(dataset, loan_status != 'Current')

```

```{r validation set approach}
# setting a seed for reproducability
set.seed(7)
# We randomly split our dataframe in a train and test set
classification_trainRows = sample(1:nrow(concluded_loans),0.5*nrow(concluded_loans))
classification_trainRows = nrow(concluded_loans) - classification_trainRows

```

```{r change loan_status to defaulted}
levels(concluded_loans$loan_status)
# For the remaining observations, check if the loan_status is “Fully Paid”. If not, change
# the value of loan_status to “DEFAULTED”.

# My understanding is that we need to change all the values but "Fully Paid" to "Default"

concluded_loans$loan_status[concluded_loans$loan_status != "Fully Paid"] <- "Default"


```
